GET /users/:user_id.description: Responds with an object containing the users user_id, name, email and admin status

POST /users.description: Posts a users details to the database
POST /users.notes: Request body can accept extra fields

DELETE /users/:user_id.description: Deletes the user details specified by the user_id and any signups, saved events, or events linked to them

GET /events.description: Responds with an array of event objects
queries: limit - number of events in array (default 10)
type - can be 'current' or 'all'. 'current' filters out past events and events that have reached the signup limit
searchTerm - filters events by a searchTerm
sortby - Can be date, price, or id
orderby - Can be asc or desc

GET /events/:event_id.description: Responds with all the event info for the event with the corresponding ID

exampleResponse.description: Get an exclusive tour of NASA

DELETE /events/:event_id.description: Deletes the event specified by the ID

POST /events.description: Adds an event to the events table in the db

requestFormat.description: Get an exclusive tour of NASA

exampleResponse.description: Get an exclusive tour of NASA

POST /events.notes: price, image_URL, end_time, signup_limit can be null. Request body ignores any additional fields.

GET /events/:event_id/users.description: Responds with the users that have signed up to that event
queries: limit - number of events in array
searchTerm - filters events by a searchTerm

GET /users/:user_id/signups.description: Responds with an array of events that the user has signed up to
queries: limit - number of events in array
type - can be curr (upcoming signups) or past (events that have taken place). Default returns all signups

POST /users/:user_id/signups.description: Posts a user_id and event_id to the signup table

DELETE /users/:user_id/signups/:event_id.description: Deletes a user from the signup table effectively removing them from the event

GET /users/:user_id/saved.description: Responds with an array of events that the user has saved
queries: limit - number of events in array
type - can be curr (upcoming events) or past (events that have taken place). Default returns all saved events

POST /users/:user_id/saved.description: Posts a user_id and event_id to the saved_events table

DELETE /users/:user_id/saved/:event_id.description: Deletes a user from the saved table.

GET /events/organiser/:organiser_id.description: Responds with an array of events organised by the specified organiser.
queries: limit - number of events in array (default 10)
type - can be curr (upcoming events) or past (events that have taken place). Default returns all events
